sen.j: 天目茶碗（てんもくぢゃわん）とは、天目釉と呼ばれる釉薬をかけて焼かれた陶器製の茶碗のこと。
sen.e: Tenmokujawan means a pottery tea bowl that is fired by using glaze called Tenmoku glaze.

sen.j: 鉄釉を用いて焼かれた陶磁器は中国においては、周の時代に遡るが、本格的な製造は東晋期に現在の浙江省にあった徳清窯で焼かれたものであるとされている。
sen.e: Though the history of ceramics that were fired by using tetsuyu (glaze containing iron) in China dates back to the ages of Zhou, full-fledged production is believed to have started in the ages of Eastern Jin at Dequing kiln, which was located in current Zhejian Province.

sen.j: 宋 (王朝)以後盛んに制作されるようになった。
sen.e: Production became active during the ages of Sun (dynasty).

sen.j: その頃日本では禅宗が盛んになった鎌倉時代にあたり、中国禅宗の中心であったあった浙江の天目山 (浙江省)に留学した禅僧が喫茶の習慣とともにこれを日本に持ち帰った。
sen.e: As the ages of Sun corresponded to the Kamakura period in Japan when Zen sect was prosperous, Zen monks who went to Tenmokuzan (Zhejian Province) in Zhejian Province, which was the center of Chinese Zen sect, brought back the products to Japan together with the practice of drinking tea.

sen.j: この事から、鉄釉のかかった茶碗を「天目」と称し、その中でも特に鼈口を有した2段の口造り構造となった天目の茶碗は中の茶の保温に優れたものとして茶道を愛好するものに好まれたために、こうした茶碗を「天目茶碗」と呼んで珍重して、台子点前・貴人点などの重要な茶会などの際にも用いられた。
sen.e: Because of the above history, tea bowls produced by using tetsuyu were called "Tenmoku", and among them, those that have supponguchi (a mouth in the shape of soft-shell turtle) were specifically called "Tenmokujawan", were valued by tea ceremony lovers because of their excellent ability to keep tea warm and were used at important tea ceremonies such as Daisu-temae and Kijin-date.

sen.j: 天目を焼くために用いられる釉薬（鉄質黒釉）は、釉薬の中に含まれている鉄分によって黒く発色する。
sen.e: Glaze (black glaze containing iron) used to fire Tenmoku makes products black due to the action of iron contained in it.

sen.j: 従って、鉄分の含有量によって、その色合いが異なり、鉄分が少ない天目は飴釉（あめゆう）、多い天目は柿釉（かきゆう）とも称されている。
sen.e: Therefore, color of products varies depending on the contained amount of iron, and Tenmoku glaze which contains less iron is called "ameyu" while Tenmoku glaze which contains much iron is called "kakiyu".

sen.j: 天目茶碗の代表的な物として、現在の福建省建甌市（元の建甌県）にある建窯で作られた建盞（けんさん）と呼ばれるものや、江西省吉安県にある吉州窯で作られた玳皮盞（たいひさん）/鼈盞（べつさん）が挙げられる。
sen.e: Representative Tenmokujawan are products called Kensan, which were produced at Ken kiln located in Jianou City (former Jianou prefecture), Fujian Province, and those called Taihisan/Bessan, which were produced at Kisshu kiln located in Jian Prefecture, Jiangxi Province.
